title: As Migrant Children Were Put to Work, U.S. Ignored Warnings
abstract: The White House and federal agencies were repeatedly alerted to signs of children at risk. The warnings were ignored or missed.

title: 84-Year-Old Is Charged in Shooting of Black Teenager Who Went to Wrong House
abstract: Lawyers for the family of Ralph Yarl, 16, said he was critically injured when he was shot twice in Kansas City, Mo.

title: Man Charged With Murder in Shooting of Woman Who Went Up Wrong Driveway
abstract: Kevin Monahan shot Kaylin Gillis, 20, when she and several friends wound up outside his house in a rural part of upstate New York, the authorities said.

title: Len Goodman, ‘Dancing With the Stars’ Judge, Dies at 78
abstract: Mr. Goodman, who was also a longtime judge on the British show “Strictly Come Dancing,” was known for his wry humor, wit and colorful phrases.

title: Ad Flap Leaves Bitter Aftertaste for Bud Light and Warning for Big Business
abstract: Bud Light’s marketing effort with a transgender influencer has put it “in the center of the culture wars in a way that no company could possibly want to be,” one observer said.

title: On Eve of Trial, Discovery of Carlson Texts Set Off Crisis Atop Fox
abstract: Private messages sent by Tucker Carlson that had been redacted in legal filings showed him making highly offensive remarks that went beyond the comments of his prime-time show.

title: Disney Sues DeSantis Over Control of Its Florida Resort
abstract: The company claimed “a targeted campaign of government retaliation,” which it said stemmed from its criticism of a contentious state education law.

title: ‘The Godfather of A.I.’ Leaves Google and Warns of Danger Ahead
abstract: For half a century, Geoffrey Hinton nurtured the technology at the heart of chatbots like ChatGPT. Now he worries it will cause serious harm.

title: Vice Is Said to Be Headed for Bankruptcy
abstract: The company, which was once valued at $5.7 billion, has been struggling to find a buyer this year.
